newsitem.title: UK: Squatters see eviction from Guinness London site.
newsitem.headline: Squatters see eviction from Guinness London site.

text.p: A group of squatters camping on wasteland in inner-city London owned by British beer and spirits giant Guinness Plc said on Monday they expected an attempt to evict them to begin on Tuesday.
The site of the 13-acre former distillery, bordering on the River Thames in the Wandsworth district of southwest London, is earmarked for a riverside housing and supermarket development.
The protestors, from a group called "The Land is Ours", argue there are already too many supermarkets in the area and said they have the backing of local people for their occupation.
Guinness has a court order to expel the protestors, who want to bring attention to the lack of cheap housing in inner cities despite many derelict sites being left unused for years.
